documentation.p: Dependencies can be used between Services and Entities, they won't need any stereotype assigned to them. These dependencies are used to produce entity references (from an entity or service) within the base classes (i.e. DaoBase and ServiceBase), or to produce service references (from another service) within the ServiceBase classes.

Entity business operations can be set to classifier scope instead of the usual instance scope. By doing so they will be generated into the corresponding DAO for that entity instead of the entity implementation class.
Entity query operations (i.e. finders) can be denoted by setting the query flag on the modeled operation to true (they do not require any stereotypes) and setting it's scope to classifier.

Actors represent roles within your model. To designate that a role has access to a given service you must draw a dependency from an Actor to the <<Service>>. To designate the role has access to to a given operation, you must draw a dependency from an Actor to the operation.

element.name: ENTITY
element.documentation: Produces a POJO EJB entity.

element.name: MAPPED_SUPERCLASS
element.documentation: Produces a POJO class annotated as a mapped/embeddable super class. This can only be assigned to the root class in a hierarchy.

element.name: SERVICE
element.documentation: Produces a Session EJB facade for the POJO EJB entities.

element.name: MESSAGE_DRIVEN
element.documentation: Produces a JMS Message Driven EJB facade that received messages.

element.name: ENUMERATION
element.documentation: This stereotype will instruct to define an enumeration class variable of type enum introduced in JDK 1.5. That way it is possible for Entities to use this enumeration type for their attributes.

element.name: VERSION
element.documentation:
Identifies an attribute as an version property (optimistic lock value) of an entity. Used to ensure integrity when reattaching and for overall optimistic concurrency control. Only one attribute per entity class is allowed to have the Version stereotype. The following types are supported:
int
Integer
short
Short
long
Long
Timestamp

element.name: TRANSIENT
element.documentation: Identifies an entity attribute as a transient attribute which is non persistent.

element.name: PERSISTENCE_CONTEXT
element.documentation: Identifies a persistence context used to express a dependency on an EntityManager persistence context.

element.name: IDENTIFIER
element.documentation: Identifies an attribute as an identifier (primary key).

element.name: CREATE_METHOD
element.documentation: Used to tag an EJB create method NOTE: However POJO constructors are used in EJB3

element.name: ENTITY_REF
element.documentation: Used to reference an entity from another entity or service.
element.appliedOnElement: A dependency going into an Entity

element.name: SERVICE_REF
element.documentation: Used to reference a service from an entity or another service.
element.appliedOnElement: A dependency going into a Service

element.name: RESOURCE_REF
element.documentation: Used to reference a resource, like a DataSource from a service bean.
element.appliedOnElement: A dependency going into a class having a stereotype of UserTransaction or DataSource, out of a Service.

element.name: USER_TRANSACTION
element.documentation: Used to inject a javax.transaction.UserTransaction resource.

element.name: DATA_SOURCE
element.documentation: Used to inject a javax.sql.DataSource resource.

element.name: INTERCEPTOR
element.documentation: Defines a custome made interceptor for the business methods of the session bean and message driven bean.

element.name: LISTENER
element.documentation: Defines a callback listener class for the entity, session and message driven beans. The corresponding entity, session or message driven beans are annotated to indicate the listener class.

element.name: SECURITY_RUN_AS
element.documentation: Represents a dependency from an actor that is identified to apply a run-as identity to the bean when making calls. It does not affect the identity of the method callers.

element.name: VALUE_REF
element.documentation: Used to generate an association between an entity and a value object class. Found attributes inside the entity as well as the value object are used to get automatically filled out. The entity will provide the helper method, also for saving a value object to an existing entity. NOTE: This should not be used any longer with EJB3 as there are no value object.
element.appliedOnElement: A dependency going into a ValueObject and out of an Entity

element.name: ENV_ENTRY
element.documentation: Used to specify an environment entry which is defined in the ejb-jar.xml descriptor and can be injected in a bean.

element.name: SERVICE_TIMER_TIMEOUT
element.documentation: Specifies whether the session bean operation as a Timer Service timeout callback method.

element.name: RESULT_TYPE_FIRST
element.documentation: Specifies the finder method parameter result type to specify the starting index.

element.name: RESULT_TYPE_MAX
element.documentation: Specifies the finder method parameter result type to specify the max or limit.

element.name: POST_CONSTRUCT
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler and will be invoked when the bean is first created, after any dependency injection is required.

element.name: PRE_DESTROY
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler and will be invoked when the bean is removed from the pool or destroyed. For stateful session beans, this occurs before the @Remove annotated method is invoked.

element.name: POST_ACTIVATE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for a stateful session bean and will be invoked when the bean instance has just been reactivated.

element.name: PRE_PASSIVATE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for a stateful session bean and will be invoked when container is ready to passivate the instance.

element.name: PRE_PERSIST
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked before the entity is created in the database and will cascade to all associated cascadable entities.

element.name: POST_PERSIST
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked after the entity is created in the database and will cascade to all associated cascadable entities.

element.name: PRE_REMOVE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked before the entity is deleted from the database and will cascade to all associated cascadable entities.

element.name: POST_REMOVE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked after the entity is deleted from the database and will cascade to all associated cascadable entities.

element.name: PRE_UPDATE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked right before the database is updated.

element.name: POST_UPDATE
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked immediately after the database has been updated.

element.name: POST_LOAD
element.documentation: Specifies that the associated operation is a lifecycle callback handler for an entity bean and will be invoked right after the data has been loaded from the database and associated with the entity.

element.name: WEB_SERVICE
element.documentation: Exposes ALL methods of the session bean as a web service.

element.name: WEB_SERVICE_OPERATION
element.documentation: This is used in conjunction with the <<Service>> stereotype. Adds the method to the list of allowed methods which will be exposed as a web service. You MUST place this stereotype on an operation if you want it exposed as a web service (unless you add the <<WebService>> stereotype to your class).

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT
element.documentation: Indicates this bean is a Seam component object. This must be set before anything else is modeled on the class.

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_STARTUP
element.documentation: Specifies that a session scope component is started immediately at session creation time, unless dependencies are specified.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_IN
element.documentation: Indicates a Seam component attribute which is to be injected from a context variable at the begining of each component method invocation.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_OUT
element.documentation: Indicates a Seam component attribute which is to be outjected to a context variable at the end of each component method invocation.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_UNWRAP
element.documentation: Specifies that the object returned by the annotated getter method is the thing that is injected instead of the component instance itself.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_FACTORY
element.documentation:
When this stereotype is used on an operation which return void that operation will be used to initialize the value of the named context variable, when the context variable has no value.
When it is used on an operation that returns a value then Seam should use that value to initialize the value of the named context variable, when the context variable has no value.
The context variable is specified by tagged value andromda_seam_bijection_factory_value. If the method is a getter method, default to the JavaBeans property name.
If no scope is explicitly specified by tagged value andromda_seam_bijection_factory_scope, the scope of the component with the @Factory method is used (unless the component is stateless, in which case the EVENT context is used).

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_LOGGER
element.documentation: Specifies that a component field is to be injected with an instance of org.jboss.seam.log.Log.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_REQUEST_PARAMETER
element.documentation: Specifies that a component attribute is to be injected with the value of a request parameter. Basic type conversions are performed automatically.

element.name: SEAM_LIFECYCLE_CREATE
element.documentation: Indicates that the method is a Seam component lifecycle operation and should be called when an instance of the component is instantiated by Seam.

element.name: SEAM_LIFECYCLE_DESTROY
element.documentation: Indicates that the method is a Seam component lifecycle operation and should be called when the context ends and its context variables are destroyed. All SFSB components must define a Destroy method to guarantee destruction of the SFSB when the context ends.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_BEGIN
element.documentation: Specifies that a long-running conversation begins when this method returns a non-null outcome without exception.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_END
element.documentation: Specifies that a long-running conversation ends when this method returns a non-null outcome without exception.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_BEGIN_TASK
element.documentation: Specifies that a long-running conversation ends when this method returns a non-null outcome without exception.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_START_TASK
element.documentation:
"Starts" a jBPM task. Specifies that a long-running conversation begins when this method returns a non-null outcome without exception. This conversation is associated with the jBPM task specified in the named request parameter. Within the context of this conversation, a business process context is also defined, for the business process instance of the task instance.
The jBPM TaskInstance will be available in a request context variable named taskInstance. The jPBM ProcessInstance will be available in a request context variable named processInstance. (Of course, these objects are available for injection via @In.)

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_END_TASK
element.documentation: "Ends" a jBPM task. Specifies that a long-running conversation ends when this method returns a non-null outcome, and that the current task is complete. Triggers a jBPM transition. The actual transition triggered will be the default transition unless the application has called Transition.setName() on the built-in component named transition.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_CREATE_PROCESS
element.documentation: Creates a new jBPM process instance when the method returns a non-null outcome without exception. The ProcessInstance object will be available in a context variable named processInstance.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_RESUME_PROCESS
element.documentation: Re-enters the scope of an existing jBPM process instance when the method returns a non-null outcome without exception. The ProcessInstance object will be available in a context variable named processInstance.

element.name: SEAM_TRANSACTION_TRANSACTIONAL
element.documentation: Specifies that a JavaBean component should have a similar transactional behavior to the default behavior of a session bean component. ie. method invocations should take place in a transaction, and if no transaction exists when the method is called, a transaction will be started just for that method. This annotation may be applied at either class or method level.
element.appliedOnElement: Session and Java Beans and Operations

element.name: SEAM_TRANSACTION_ROLLBACK
element.documentation: If the outcome of the method matches any of the listed outcomes, or if no outcomes are listed, set the transaction to rollback only when the method completes.

element.name: SEAM_VALIDATION_VALID
element.documentation: Specifies that the Hibernate Validator should validate this and related component attributes before an action listener Seam component method is invoked.

element.name: SEAM_VALIDATION_VALIDATOR
element.documentation: Specifies that the validator should validate all Seam components marked with @Valid annotation before the method is invoked. Use of tagged values for outcome when validation fails and for refreshing entities when validation fails is provided.

element.name: SEAM_WEBREMOTE
element.documentation: Indicates that the annotated method may be called from client-side JavaScript. The exclude property is optional and allows objects to be excluded from the result's object graph.

element.name: SEAM_INTERCEPTOR
element.documentation:
This stereotype appear on Seam interceptor classes.
Please refer to the documentation for the EJB 3.0 specification for information about the annotations required for EJB interceptor definition.

element.name: SEAM_ASYNCHRONOUS
element.documentation: Specifies that the method call is processed asynchronously.

element.name: SEAM_ASYNCHRONOUS_DURATION
element.documentation: Specifies that a parameter of the asynchronous call is the duration before the call is processed (or first processed for recurring calls).
element.appliedOnElement: Session and Java Bean Operation Parameters

element.name: SEAM_ASYNCHRONOUS_EXPIRATION
element.documentation: Specifies that a parameter of the asynchronous call is the datetime at which the call is processed (or first processed for recurring calls).
element.appliedOnElement: Session and Java Bean Operation Parameters

element.name: SEAM_ASYNCHRONOUS_INTERVAL_DURATION
element.documentation: Specifies that an asynchronous method call recurs, and that the annotationed parameter is duration between recurrences.
element.appliedOnElement: Session and Java Bean Operation Parameters

element.name: SEAM_DATA_DATAMODEL
element.documentation: Exposes an attribute of type List, Map, Set or Object[] as a JSF DataModel into the scope of the owning component (or the EVENT scope if the owning component is STATELESS). In the case of Map, each row of the DataModel is a Map.Entry.

element.name: SEAM_DATA_DATAMODEL_SELECTION
element.documentation: Injects the selected value from the JSF DataModel (this is the element of the underlying collection, or the map value).

element.name: SEAM_DATA_DATAMODEL_SELECTION_INDEX
element.documentation: Exposes the selection index of the JSF DataModel as an attribute of the component (this is the row number of the underlying collection, or the map key).

element.name: ATTRIBUTE_PERSISTENCE_OPTIONAL
element.documentation: Defines the attribute non-null relationship annotations. If set to false, then a non-null relationship must always exist.

element.name: ENTITY_INHERITANCE
element.documentation:
Used to override the default entity inheritance strategy defined by the
entityInheritanceStrategy
namespace property.
Permitted values are:
SINGLE_TABLE - table per hierarchy.
TABLE_PER_CLASS - table per class in hierarchy.
JOINED - Table per class.
The tagged value of andromda_persistence_inheritance is set on the base/root class. All subclasses must then follow the same strategy. The default strategy is defined by the
entityInheritanceStrategy
namespace property.

element.name: ENTITY_DISCRIMINATOR_TYPE
element.documentation:
Used to override the default entity inheritance discriminator type defined by the
entityDiscriminatorType
namespace property.
Permitted values are:
STRING
CHAR
INTEGER
The tagged value of andromda_persistence_discriminator_type is set once on the base/root class to indicate the type of the column used for the discriminator. The default discriminator type is defined by the
entityDiscriminatorType
namespace property.

element.name: ENTITY_DISCRIMINATOR_VALUE
element.documentation: Used at the class level of an entity and is optional. This is the value that indicates that the row is an entity of the annotated entity type. It should be specified for each class in the hierarchy.

element.name: ENTITY_DISCRIMINATOR_COLUMN
element.documentation: Used at the class level of an entity and is optional. This value indicates the name of the column to be used for the discriminator. If not specified for the SINGLE_TABLE or JOINED inheritance mapping strategies, then default to TYPE.

element.name: ENTITY_DISCRIMINATOR_COLUMN_DEFINITION
element.documentation: Used at the class level of an entity and is optional. This value indicates the SQL fragment used when generating the DDL for the discriminator column.

element.name: ENTITY_DISCRIMINATOR_COLUMN_LENGTH
element.documentation: Used at the class level of an entity and is optional. This value indicates the column length for the String-based discriminator types. It is ignored for the other discriminator types.

element.name: TEMPORAL_TYPE
element.documentation: The temporal type tagged value specified on the attributes of type java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar or on finder method parameter specifying, whether to expect one of the following types Date, Time or Timestamp.
element.appliedOnElement: Entity Attribute or Entity Finder Method Parameter

element.name: FETCH_TYPE
element.documentation: Denotes whether or not to hint to the EJB3 container that the EJB relationship/property should be lazily or eagerly loaded. By default, the loading persistence is EAGER for attributes and relationships of type OneToOne and ManyToOne. Relationships with OneToMany and ManyToMany syntax are LAZY loaded. You don't need to set anything to accept these default settings.

element.name: CASCADE_TYPE
element.documentation: Specifies the override value for the default cascade setting for this relationship.

element.name: HIBERNATE_CASCADE_TYPE
element.documentation: Place a user defined Hibernate specific cascade value at an association end. Hibernate extensions must be enabled.

element.name: ENUMERATION_TYPE
element.documentation: Specifies the enumeration type for the persistent property or field.

element.name: GENERATOR_TYPE
element.documentation: Specifies the primary key generation strategy associated with an entity bean attribute identifier.

element.name: GENERATOR_NAME
element.documentation: Defines a unique name which is referenced by one or more classes to be the generator for an entity bean.

element.name: GENERATOR_GENERIC_STRATEGY
element.documentation: Defines either a predefined Hibernate strategy or a fully qualified class name for use in id generation using persistence layer extensions.

element.name: GENERATOR_SOURCE_NAME
element.documentation: Specifies either the table name that stores the generated ids or the sequence name which is the name of the database sequence object used to get the ids.

element.name: GENERATOR_PK_COLUMN_VALUE
element.documentation: The primary key value in the generator table that identifies the generated value from other values in the table.

element.name: GENERATOR_INITIAL_VALUE
element.documentation: Specifies the initial starting sequence for id generation for an entity PK generator.

element.name: GENERATOR_ALLOCATION_SIZE
element.documentation: Specifies the amount to increment by when allocating an id number from the generator.

element.name: COLUMN_DEFINITION
element.documentation: Specifies the SQL to create the DDL for the column or entity property.

element.name: COLUMN_PRECISION
element.documentation: Specifies the precision value for a decimal column.

element.name: COLUMN_SCALE
element.documentation: Specifies the scale to use for a decimal column.

element.name: COLUMN_NULLABLE
element.documentation: Specifies whether the underlying column for the entity attribute may be NULL.

element.name: COLUMN_INSERT
element.documentation: Specifies whether a mapped column should be included in SQL INSERT statements. Setting to false allows the column to be initialized using other mechanisms such as a value defaulted by thedatabase. Defaults to true.

element.name: COLUMN_UPDATE
element.documentation: Specifies whether a mapped column should be included in SQL UPDATE statements. Setting to false allows the column to be updated using other mechanisms such as a value defaulted by the database. Defaults to true.

element.name: ORDER_BY
element.documentation: Specifies the column name(s) that will be used for sorting the returned collection, with ASC or DESC optional. Without a value, the primary key is assumed.

element.name: ASSOCIATION_COLLECTION_TYPE
element.documentation: Used to define the mapping for EJB3 collections. This value overrides the namespace property.

element.name: ASSOCIATION_INDEX
element.documentation: Column containing the collection index, overrides the associationEndCollectionIndexName

element.name: ASSOCIATION_INDEX_TYPE
element.documentation: The type of the column containing the collection index, overrides the associationEndCollectionIndexType

element.name: LOB_TYPE
element.documentation: Override the entity attribute type where the property is defined as either a large binary or character type via datatype::Clob or datatype::Blob respectively. BLOB fields represent Byte[] or Serializable types. CLOB fiels represent char[], Character[] or String types. Make sure to define the fully qualified type name for the tagged value.
element.appliedOnElement: Entity Attribute of Type datatype::Clob or datatype::Blob

element.name: SERVICE_TYPE
element.documentation: Used at the class level of a service bean to override the default session bean type which is determined by the existence of instance variables.

element.name: SERVICE_PERSISTENCE_CONTEXT_UNIT_NAME
element.documentation: Used at the class level of a service bean or a class with stereotype PersistenceContext to determine the persistence context unit name.

element.name: SERVICE_PERSISTENCE_CONTEXT_TYPE
element.documentation: Used at the class level of a service bean or a class with stereotype PersistenceContext to determine the persistence context type. This can be set to extend the transaction on a Stateful session bean for it's EntityManager.

element.name: SERVICE_PERSISTENCE_CONTEXT_DATASOURCE
element.documentation: Used at the class level of a service bean or a class with stereotype PersistenceContext to determine the persistence context datasource JNDI name. If you don't have a scoped classloader for your application, all persistence contexts defined in your system's global context are made available to all applications.

element.name: SERVICE_PERSISTENCE_FLUSH_MODE
element.documentation: Used on session bean operations to set the flush mode that determines when the changes to the changes to the database are applied in a transation.

element.name: SERVICE_JNDI_NAME_REMOTE
element.documentation: Used on a session bean to manually specify the JNDI name the remote interface is bound to.

element.name: SERVICE_JNDI_NAME_LOCAL
element.documentation: Used on a session bean to manually specify the JNDI name the local interface is bound to.

element.name: TRANSACTION_MANAGEMENT
element.documentation: Specifies the transaction demarcation strategy for session and message-driven beans. By default, this does not need to be set for CONTAINER managed transaction demarcation.

element.name: SECURITY_PERMIT_ALL
element.documentation: Specifies whether to permit all roles to execute the opertions in the bean. This can be set on the session bean or on individual operations. If set on the session bean, all operations will inherit this behavior. The permit all tagged value will override the roles allowed. If both are set, only the permit all tagged value is rendered.

element.name: SECURITY_DENY_ALL
element.documentation: Specifies whether to deny all roles to execute the opertions in the bean. This can be set on the session bean or on individual operations. If set on the session bean, all operations will inherit this behavior. The deny all tagged value will override the roles allowed. If both are set, only the deny all tagged value is rendered.

element.name: SECURITY_REALM
element.documentation: Specifies the security domain for role based authorization. JBoss uses the security realm to match allowed roles.

element.name: EXCLUDE_DEFAULT_INTERCEPTORS
element.documentation: Determines whether to exclude the invocation of the default interceptors for the applied business method.

element.name: EXCLUDE_CLASS_INTERCEPTORS
element.documentation: Determines whether to exclude the invocation of the class interceptors for the applied business method.

element.name: DEFAULT_INTERCEPTOR
element.documentation: Defines the modeled interceptor as a default interceptor for all business methods of all session and message driven beans within this deployment.

element.name: AUTOMATIC_KEY
element.documentation: Can be used in class level of an entity. If you set this to true, the class will use an automatic key generation for the defined primary key. Please note: This is currently only available in BEA Weblogic and can not be used with combined primary keys.

element.name: NO_SYNTHETIC_CREATE_METHOD
element.documentation: Used on an Entity bean to decide whether to allow synthetic (auto generated) create/constructors.

element.name: QUERY
element.documentation: Defines a hibernate query expression. Note that it's encouraged to model your query body as an OCL constraint (instead of using this tagged value).
element.appliedOnElement: An Entity operation marked as a query .

element.name: VIEW_TYPE
element.documentation: Defines the view type for a Session EJB at the class level or at the operation level for each Session method.

element.name: TRANSACTION_TYPE
element.documentation: Defines a transaction type for a method in the Session EJB or for entity EJB POJO accessor method.

element.name: TABLE
element.documentation: Defines the relational table name for entity persistence.

element.name: COLUMN
element.documentation: Represents the column name for entity persistence.

element.name: COLUMN_LENGTH
element.documentation: Represents the column length for entity persistence.

element.name: MDB_ACKNOWLEDGE_MODE
element.documentation: Represents the acknowledge mode for the JMS message driven bean. Only needs to be specified if DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE mode is required. The default mode is AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE.

element.name: MDB_DESTINATION
element.documentation: Represents the destination queue or topic name this JMS message driven bean is associated with.

element.name: MDB_DESTINATION_TYPE
element.documentation: Represents the destination type of the JMS message driven bean. If not specified, it is assumed to be a Queue.

element.name: MDB_SELECTOR
element.documentation: Represents the JMS message selector logic used when determining the messages that a JMS message driven bean is to receive.

element.name: MDB_SUBSCRIPTION_DURABILITY
element.documentation: Represents the JMS message driven bean subscription durability mode. Queues are always durable. The durability only needs to be specified on topics. By default, topics are non-durable.

element.name: MDB_MINIMUM_POOL_SIZE
element.documentation: Defines the bean's minimum pool size. Must be an integer and greater than 0, otherwise will not be set.

element.name: MDB_MAXIMUM_POOL_SIZE
element.documentation: Defines the bean's maximum pool size. Can be used to define singleton message driven beans. Must be an integer and greater than 0, otherwise will not be set.

element.name: ENTITY_CACHE
element.documentation: Defines the cache strategy the entity.

element.name: ASSOCIATION_CACHE
element.documentation: Defines the cache strategy for relationship association collection.

element.name: USE_QUERY_CACHE
element.documentation: Used to override the default option that enables/disable query cache.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_PARAMETER_STYLE
element.documentation: Specifies the method parameters represent the entire message body or are elements wrapped inside a top-level element named after the webservice operation.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_OPERATION_ONEWAY
element.documentation: Specifies the method has only an input message and no output. A oneway method returns the thread of control to the calling application prior to executing the actual business method. Do not model on operations that have a return value or holder parameters or declare any checked exceptions.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_OPERATION_NAME
element.documentation: Specifies the web service method name.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_OPERATION_RESULT_NAME
element.documentation: Specifies the web service method result name.

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_NAME
element.documentation: Override the default Seam component object name.

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_SCOPE_TYPE
element.documentation: The JBoss Seam component scope type. The default for stateless session beans is STATELESS. The default for entity beans and stateful session beans is CONVERSATION.

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_ROLE_NAME
element.documentation:
Allows a Seam component to be bound to multiple contexts variables. The @Name/@Scope annotations define a "default role". Each @Role annotation defines an additional role.
This tagged value specifies the context variable name.

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_ROLE_SCOPE_TYPE
element.documentation:
The context variable scope. When no scope is explicitly specified, the default depends upon the component type, as above.
Note! If multiple roles are specified then the list of scopes must be in the same order as the role names.

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_INTERCEPT
element.documentation: Determines when Seam interceptors are active. When no interception type is explicitly specified, the default depends upon the component type. For entity beans, the default is NEVER. For session beans, message driven beans and JavaBeans, the default is ALWAYS.

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_JNDI_NAME
element.documentation: Specifies the JNDI name that Seam will use to look up the EJB component. If no JNDI name is explicitly specified, Seam will use the JNDI pattern specified by org.jboss.seam.core.init.jndiPattern.

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_CONVERSIONAL_IFNOTBEGUNOUTCOME
element.documentation: Specifies that a conversation scope component is conversational, meaning that no method of the component can be called unless a long-running conversation started by this component is active (unless the method would begin a new long-running conversation).

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_STARTUP_DEPENDS
element.documentation: Specifies that the named components must be started first, if they are installed.

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_SYNCHRONIZED_TIMEOUT
element.documentation: Specifies that a component is accessed concurrently by multiple clients, and that Seam should serialize requests. If a request is not able to obtain its lock on the component in the given timeout period, an exception will be raised.

element.name: SEAM_COMPONENT_READONLY
element.documentation: Specifies that a JavaBean component or component method does not require state replication at the end of the invocation.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_IN_CREATE
element.documentation: Specifies that Seam should instantiate the component with the same name as the context variable if the context variable is undefined (null) in all contexts. Default to false.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_IN_VALUE
element.documentation: Specifies the name of the context variable. Default to the name of the component attribute. Alternatively, specifies a JSF EL expression, surrounded by #{...}.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_OUT_VALUE
element.documentation: Specifies the name of the context variable explicitly, instead of using the annotated instance variable name.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_OUT_SCOPE_TYPE
element.documentation:
Specifies that a component attribute that is not a Seam component type is to be outjected to a specific scope at the end of the invocation.
Alternatively, if no scope is explicitly specified, the scope of the component with the @Out attribute is used (or the EVENT scope if the component is stateless).

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_FACTORY_VALUE
element.documentation: Specifies the name of the context variable. If the method is a getter method, default to the JavaBeans property name.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_FACTORY_SCOPE_TYPE
element.documentation: Specifies the scope that Seam should bind the returned value to. Only meaningful for factory methods which return a value.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_LOGGER_VALUE
element.documentation: Specifies the name of the log category. Default to the name of the component class.

element.name: SEAM_BIJECTION_REQUEST_PARAMETER_VALUE
element.documentation: Specifies the name of the request parameter. Default to the name of the component attribute.

element.name: SEAM_LIFECYCLE_OBSERVER_EVENT
element.documentation: Specifies that the method should be called when a component-driven event of the specified type occurs.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_BEGIN_IF_OUTCOME
element.documentation:
Specifies that a long-running conversation begins when this action listener method returns with one of the given outcomes.
Example: @Begin(ifOutcome={"success", "continue"})

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_BEGIN_JOIN
element.documentation: Specifies that if a long-running conversation is already in progress, the conversation context is simply propagated.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_BEGIN_NESTED
element.documentation: Specifies that if a long-running conversation is already in progress, a new nested conversation context begins. The nested conversation will end when the next @End is encountered, and the outer conversation will resume. It is perfectly legal for multiple nested conversations to exist concurrently in the same outer conversation.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_BEGIN_FLUSH_MODE
element.documentation: Specify the flush mode of any Seam-managed persistence contexts. flushMode=FlushModeType.MANUAL supports the use of atomic conversations where all write operations are queued in the conversation context until an explicit call to flush() (which usually occurs at the end of the conversation).

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_BEGIN_PAGEFLOW
element.documentation: Specifies a jBPM process definition name that defines the pageflow for this conversation.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_END_IF_OUTCOME
element.documentation: Specifies that a long-running conversation ends when this action listener method returns with one of the given outcomes.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_END_BEFORE_REDIRECT
element.documentation: By default, the conversation will not actually be destroyed until after any redirect has occurred. Setting beforeRedirect=true specifies that the conversation should be destroyed at the end of the current request, and that the redirect will be processed in a new temporary conversation context.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_END_EVEN_IF_EXCEPTION
element.documentation: Specifies that a long-running conversation ends when this action listener method throws one of the specified classes of exception.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_START_TASK_ID_PARAMETER
element.documentation: The name of a request parameter which holds the id of the task. Default to "taskId", which is also the default used by the Seam taskList JSF component.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_START_TASK_FLUSH_MODE
element.documentation: Set the flush mode of any Seam-managed Hibernate sessions or JPA persistence contexts that are created during this conversation.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_BEGIN_TASK_ID_PARAMETER
element.documentation: The name of a request parameter which holds the id of the task. Default to "taskId", which is also the default used by the Seam taskList JSF component.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_BEGIN_TASK_FLUSH_MODE
element.documentation: Set the flush mode of any Seam-managed Hibernate sessions or JPA persistence contexts that are created during this conversation.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_END_TASK_TRANSITION_NAME
element.documentation: Triggers the given jBPM transition.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_END_TASK_IF_OUTCOME
element.documentation: Specifies the JSF outcome or outcomes that result in the end of the task.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_END_TASK_BEFORE_REDIRECT
element.documentation: By default, the conversation will not actually be destroyed until after any redirect has occurred. Setting beforeRedirect=true specifies that the conversation should be destroyed at the end of the current request, and that the redirect will be processed in a new temporary conversation context.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_CREATE_PROCESS_DEFINITION
element.documentation: The name of the jBPM process definition deployed via org.jboss.seam.core.jbpm.processDefinitions.

element.name: SEAM_CONVERSATION_RESUME_PROCESS_PROCESS_ID_PARAMETER
element.documentation: The name a request parameter holding the process id. Default to "processId".

element.name: SEAM_TRANSACTION_ROLLBACK_IF_OUTCOME
element.documentation: The JSF outcomes that cause a transaction rollback (no outcomes is interpreted to mean any outcome).

element.name: SEAM_VALIDATION_OUTCOME
element.documentation: Returns the JSF outcome when validation fails.

element.name: SEAM_VALIDATION_REFRESH_ENTITIES
element.documentation: Specifies whether invalid entities in the managed state should be refreshed from the database when validation fails.

element.name: SEAM_WEBREMOTE_EXCLUDE
element.documentation: Excludes objects from the WebRemote call result's object graph (see the Remoting chapter for more details).

element.name: SEAM_INTERCEPTOR_STATELESS
element.documentation: Specifies that this interceptor is stateless and Seam may optimize replication.

element.name: SEAM_INTERCEPTOR_TYPE
element.documentation: Specifies that this interceptor is a "client-side" interceptor that is called before the EJB container.

element.name: SEAM_INTERCEPTOR_AROUND
element.documentation: Specifies that this interceptor is positioned higher in the stack than the given interceptors.

element.name: SEAM_INTERCEPTOR_WITHIN
element.documentation: Specifies that this interceptor is positioned deeper in the stack than the given interceptors.

element.name: SEAM_DATA_DATAMODEL_VALUE
element.documentation: Name of the conversation context variable. Default to the attribute name.

element.name: SEAM_DATA_DATAMODEL_SCOPE_TYPE
element.documentation: If scope=ScopeType.PAGE is explicitly specified, the DataModel will be kept in the PAGE context.

element.name: SEAM_DATA_DATAMODEL_SELECTION_VALUE
element.documentation: Name of the conversation context variable. Not needed if there is exactly one @DataModel in the component.

element.name: SEAM_DATA_DATAMODEL_SELECTION_INDEX_VALUE
element.documentation: Name of the conversation context variable. Not needed if there is exactly one @DataModel in the component.

element.name: SEAM_DATA_DATABINDER_CLASS
element.documentation:
This meta-annotation make it possible to implement similar functionality to @DataModel and @DataModelSelection for other datastructures apart from lists.
The class name of the DataModelBinder class

element.name: SEAM_DATA_DATASELECTOR_CLASS
element.documentation:
This meta-annotation make it possible to implement similar functionality to @DataModel and @DataModelSelection for other datastructures apart from lists.
The DataModelSelector class.
